summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum summarizing a multi-level mortality review of inmate deaths in the Northeast Region, including Jeffrey Epstein. It notes Epstein's death was a suicide by hanging and identifies quality of care issues at MCC New York related to AED equipment maintenance and suicide review protocols, though these issues did not directly cause his death. The document requires a corrective action plan from the institution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The 66-year-old inmate (#76318-054) who died by suicide via hanging at MCC New York on August 10, 2019. The document details his medical history and the timeline of events leading to his death.

persons.name: Fluker Roy
persons.context: A 64-year-old male inmate who died of congestive heart failure at FMC Devens on June 18, 2019. His death was reviewed as part of the mortality review and was found to have no issues.

persons.name: Charles Phillips
persons.context: A 68-year-old male inmate who died of heart failure at an unspecified location on May 13, 2019. His death was reviewed and found to have no issues.

persons.name: Lee Garling
persons.context: A 78-year-old male inmate who died of pneumonia at FCI Elkton on May 6, 2019. His death was reviewed and found to have no issues.

persons.name: Anthony Hornbaker
persons.context: A 60-year-old male inmate who died of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease at FCI Loretto on June 28, 2019. His death was reviewed and found to have no issues.

events.title: Epstein placed on suicide watch
events.description: At 2:00 am, Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch for 31 hours and 5 minutes due to an abrasion found on the lower anterior surface of his neck.

events.title: Epstein removed from suicide watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was taken off suicide watch and placed on psychological observation.

events.title: Epstein placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was removed from psychological observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit where he was housed with a cell mate.

events.title: Epstein denies suicidal ideation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was seen by Psychology Services and denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 a.m., Special Housing Unit staff found Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated, medical staff and EMS responded, but he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. by the ER Physician. The cause was determined to be suicide by hanging.

events.title: Mortality review conducted
events.description: An independent consultant reviewed the medical records of inmates who died, including Jeffrey Epstein, and provided analysis identifying quality of care issues at MCC New York.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide via hanging at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

The mortality review identified quality of care issues at MCC New York related to the inspection, testing, and maintenance of AED (Automated External Defibrillator) units, though these issues did not directly contribute to Epstein's death.
Epstein had been placed on suicide watch on July 23, 2019, due to an abrasion on his neck, but was removed the next day and later denied any suicidal ideation on August 8.
The document requires MCC New York to develop a corrective action plan addressing AED protocols and including Health Services staff in psychological suicide reconstruction reviews.
Four other inmate deaths in the Northeast Region were reviewed and found to have no quality of care issues; all were from natural causes.
